name: TheAtlantic
text: "The 2020 electoral outcome‚ÄîDemocratic White House, Republican Senate‚Äîwas the worst one in terms of getting anything done in the Capitol, and is thus a pending disaster for the country‚Äôs sick, unemployed, and poor," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/IaTJlA4MK5

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A responsible commander in chief would be underscoring the stability and strength of U.S. defense and intelligence agencies during the presidential transition. But that‚Äôs not the commander in chief we have," @KoriSchake writes: https://t.co/mtoHz3uYE6

text: Christopher Landon's new body-swap film, "Freaky," is bracingly irreverent without sacrificing the scare factor, a combination that‚Äôs been missing from a lot of Hollywood‚Äôs horror output in the last decade, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/BmZ6yO4uEO

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Xi Jinping‚Äôs China is an infirm colossus that will be frustrated by unmet ambitions. A strong but frustrated country poses a special kind of danger. This is the China Nightmare," @DAlexBlumenthal writes: https://t.co/F6GqSgyqJB

text: Twitter created an exemption to its policies specifically so it wouldn't have to ban Donald Trump while he was president. What happens come January? https://t.co/pWgwSI8oLw

name: TheAtlantic
text: For centuries, villagers in Brazil's river towns have blamed pink dolphins for all sorts of heinous crimes. The myth is receding‚Äîand now the dolphins are under attack, writes @sushmaaaaaaaa. https://t.co/J8gYzWQCt2

name: TheAtlantic
text: The expertise of health-care workers is keeping COVID-19 deaths at bay. As this new surge overwhelms them, their ability to save patients' lives could falter, writes @edyong209: https://t.co/SZv6vDvHt0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: üö®I wrote about what health-care workers are going through, how exhausted & scared they are, and what this 3rd pandemic surge is doing to them.

text: RT @amandamull: You can get more PPE or manufacture more ventilators but you can‚Äôt summon more doctors and ICU nurses out of thin air. They‚Äôre the ceiling on how much covid the country can take, and we‚Äôre now beyond their capacity. New from @edyong209: https://t.co/UU2SUU5hRI

text: For the photographer Amber N. Ford, the death of 12-year-old Tamir Rice was a breaking point, @DrAlliRich writes. Ford pored over his story, and others like it, then mined her community for found art. https://t.co/IzRu6pXnVp

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Dan Cosby's journey hasn't been easy. But after facing many obstacles, he improved his health‚Äîand now he's on a mission to help others. Read more about his journey: https://t.co/foe5ecNUt2 https://t.co/RPQI4k6HTt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump‚Äôs performative intransigence may or may not hurt American democracy in the long run, but in the short run, it risks thousands of excess COVID-19 deaths, with the potential toll increasing the longer his tantrum continues," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/494MALm69W

name: TheAtlantic
